data.name: index_econsole
data.value: The Bacula console command $1 could not communicate with the Bacula director. Make sure the password in $2 is correct.

data.name: index_econsole2
data.value: The Bacula console command $1 is not configured with a valid Bacula director host. It is currently using $2, which does not exist.

data.name: index_fixpass
data.value: Click Here to Fix The Console Password

data.name: index_fixaddr
data.value: Click Here to Fix The Bacula Director Host

data.name: index_stopdesc
data.value: Click this button to shut down the Bacula daemon processes listed above.

data.name: index_startdesc
data.value: Click this button to start up the Bacula daemon processes listed above.

data.name: index_restartdesc
data.value: Click this button to stop and re-start the Bacula daemon processes listed above. This may be needed to activate storage device configurations.

data.name: index_applydesc
data.value: Click this button to activate the Bacula director configuration shown above.

data.name: index_bootdesc
data.value: Change this option to control whether or not Bacula is started at system boot time.

data.name: index_notrun
data.value: Backups and other operations cannot be performed as the Bacula Directory daemon is down.

data.name: index_eversion
data.value: Your system is using Bacula version $2, but this Webmin module only supports versions $1 and above.

data.name: connect_emysql
data.value: Failed to load the database DBI driver $1

data.name: connect_elogin
data.value: Failed to login to the database $1 : $2.

data.name: connect_equery
data.value: The database $1 does not appear to contain Bacula tables.

data.name: connect_equery2
data.value: This may be because the SQLite Perl module installed is too new, and does not support the older SQLite database format used by Bacula.

data.name: connect_equery3
data.value: The database $1 does not appear to contain OC Bacula group tables.
